jx.jx_en_mean: ( chiefly N. Amer. & Austral. )out of order; not working
jx.jx_cn_mean: (主北美，，主澳 )紊乱，次序颠倒；出故障

lj.lj_ly: all their calculations were out of whack.
the car has a top whack of 107 mph.
lj.lj_ls: 这部车最高时速为107英里。

phrase.cizu_name: have a whack at 或 take a whack at 【非正式用语】

jx.jx_en_mean: Improperly ordered or balanced; not functioning correctly.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不正常，有毛病：顺序不对或不平衡，不能正确履行功能

jx.jx_en_mean: Under the influence of a mind-altering drug.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 醉了的，中毒的：处于引起意识的改变的药物影响之下的

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: imitative, or perhaps an alteration of thwack

entry.def: If you whack someone or something, you hit them hard.

example.ex: You really have to whack the ball...
example.tran: 你真的需要猛击球才行。

example.ex: Someone whacked him on the head.
example.tran: 有人狠狠地打了他的头。

entry.def: Your whack of something is your share of it.

example.ex: The majority of people in this country pay their whack...
example.tran: 该国大部分人尽了他们的一份力。

example.ex: We need to win a fair whack of the contracts.
example.tran: 我们需要赢得这些合同中的相当大的份额。

entry.def: If someone whacks you, they defeat you easily in a game or competition.

example.ex: We got whacked. On paper we should have wiped the floor with them.
example.tran: 我们被轻易地击败了。按理说我们本应该大败他们。

entry.def: To whack someone means to kill them.

example.ex: His mother was murdered. Yeah, she got whacked. Snuffed out.
example.tran: 他母亲是被谋杀的。是的，是被人干掉的，弄死的。

entry.tran: 不正常的;紊乱的；出故障的
entry.def: If something is out of whack, it is not working properly, often because its natural balance has been upset.

example.ex: The ecosystem will be thrown out of whack.
example.tran: 生态系统将会失去平衡。

means.word_mean: 1. the sound made by a sharp swift blow

auth_sentence.content: Which is why your analogy is out of whack.

sentences.en: Don’t bother trying to call me on my mobile.It’s out of whack again.
sentences.cn: 不要打我的手机,它又出问题了。

sentences.en: After years of dieting, Carol’s metabolism was completely out of whack.
sentences.cn: 经过数年的节食,卡罗尔的新陈代谢完全紊乱了。
